abstract: Television broadcast in Tunisia of animated film Persepolis touches off accusations of heresy and censorship, roiling political parties in contentious debate ahead of elections.
snippet: The broadcast of the film “Persepolis,” with a scene in which God is depicted, has offended many and sharpened differences between political parties.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: The broadcast of the film “Persepolis,” with a scene in which God is depicted, has offended many and sharpened differences between political parties.

headline.main: Broadcast of an Animated Film Roils Tunisia Before Elections
headline.print_headline: Broadcast of an Animated Film Roils Tunisia Before Elections
headline.seo: Tunisia Elections Roiled by Dispute Over the Film ‘Persepolis’
